Text: two girls (trump supporters) pretended to be part of the protest in Madison, WI and destroyed property. The first picture was taken when a black man took them aside to explain how they were hurting the movement. Now we know their actions were intentional.
"The president of the United States must be part of the solution not the problem. This president today is part of the problem and accelerates it," Biden says.

We have now watched an armed attack, instigated by the president of the United States, on peaceful, law-abiding demonstrators exercising their Constitutional rights. All of Trump's actions and words have etched today as a grim moment in American history.

Note: Trump is literally drawing on one of the most ubiquitous phrases of Nazi Party propaganda. "Ein Volk, ein Reich, ein Führer." "One (racial) national people. One empire. One leader." It means, "The one law is total obedience." This is fascism in giant blinking neon lights

Trump had time to call Putin today before threatening to use the US military to attack Americans. But he hasn't had time to talk to a pained protestor or one of 105k families suffering the loss of a relative from coronavirus or one of 40M Americans struggling with job loss.

Trump's words to America's Governor's are not the words of an American President. They are the words of a thug and autocrat who despises our countries most sacred ideas and ideals. Trump is the author of unprecedented American weakness. Chaos, disease, death and economic collapse

Trump just had peaceful demonstrators viciously attacked.  No, Mr. President. This is not a dictatorship. This is the United States of America. Our citizens have a constitutional right to peacefully protest. It's called the First Amendment.
